Container.Name: FileBot
Container.Overview:
FileBot is the ultimate tool for organizing and renaming your movies, tv shows or anime, and music well as downloading subtitles and artwork. It's smart and just works.
The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small.
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-filebot#readme
Container.Description:
FileBot is the ultimate tool for organizing and renaming your movies, tv shows or anime, and music well as downloading subtitles and artwork. It's smart and just works.
The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on the client side) or via any VNC client.
Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small.
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-filebot/blob/master/README.md.
Container.Changes:
###v24.10.2 (2024-10-20) - Temporarily reverted FileBot to version 5.1.5, because 5.1.6 has an incompatiblity with JNA native library.
###v24.10.1 (2024-10-18) - Updated FileBot to version 5.1.6. - Make sure to save FileBot settings immediately.
###v24.09.1 (2024-09-29) - Updated FileBot to version 5.1.5. - Updated baseimage to version 4.6.4, which brings the following changes: - Fixed web authentication feature with URL path-based reverse proxy. - Rebuild against latest distro images to get security fixes.
###v24.07.1 (2024-07-03) - Updated MediaInfo library to version 24.06. - Updated baseimage to version 4.6.3, which brings the following changes: - Audio support through web browser. - Web authentication support. - Better support of GTK4 applications. - Updated noVNC to version 1.5.0. - Updated web UI components (Bootstrap, Font Awesome). - When connecting, the control bar is now temporarily shown only once. - During package mirror setup, make sure to keep permissions of copied files.
###v24.06.1 (2024-06-09) - Updated MediaInfo library to version 24.05.
###v24.05.1 (2024-05-02) - Updated FileBot to version 5.1.3. - Updated MediaInfo library to version 24.04.
###v24.02.1 (2024-02-17) - Updated baseimage to version 4.5.3, which brings the following changes: - Disabled fullscreen support when page is loaded into an iFrame. - Rebuilt against latest distro images to get security fixes.
###v23.11.2 (2023-11-19) - Updated FileBot to version 5.1.2. - Updated baseimage to version 4.5.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed issue that would cause the helper that takes ownership of a directory to fail when using a very high user or group ID.
###v23.11.1 (2023-11-10) - Updated baseimage to version 4.5.1, which brings the following changes: - Mirror for packages installation can be set via the `PACKAGES_MIRROR` environment variable. - Improved the way the `take-ownership` script is working. - Readiness and minimum running time checks should not be done for a service defined with an interval. - Raise an error when a synched service fails to start. - Minimum running time check of a service was using an incorrect way to verify if process is still alive. - Fixed installation of CJK font.
###v23.10.1 (2023-10-20) - Updated FileBot to version 5.1.1. - Updated MediaInfo library to version 23.10.
###v23.06.1 (2023-06-07) - Updated FileBot to version 5.0.3. - Updated baseimage to version 4.4.2, which brings the following changes: - Rebuilt against latest distro images to get security fixes. - Updated X server to version 1.20.14.
###v23.04.2 (2023-04-29) - Updated FileBot to version 5.0.2 (r9722). - Updated baseimage to version 4.4.1, which brings the following changes: - Updated TigerVNC to version 1.13.1.
###v23.04.1 (2023-04-05) - Updated ZenLib to version 0.4.41, which fixes a crash that could occur when opening video file.
###v23.03.4 (2023-03-31) - Fixed the Groovy Pad being fullscreen. - Updated MediaInfo library to version 23.03.
###v23.03.3 (2023-03-20) - Updated FileBot to version 5.0.1.
###v23.03.2 (2023-03-17) - Updated FileBot to version 5.0.0.
###v23.03.1 (2023-03-05) - Updated baseimage to version 4.4.0, which brings the following changes: - Updated components providing access to application's UI over web. - Improved web UI usage with touch devices. - Fixed issue with initialization of Linux users and groups when the `GROUP_ID` is also part of `SUP_GROUP_IDS`. - Limit the maximum number of opened files on system having a very large, unlimited value. This prevents unnecessary waste of CPU resources and time for applications trying to close all possible file descriptors.
###v23.02.2 (2023-02-08) - Updated baseimage to version 4.3.4, which brings the following changes: - Fixed error message from openbox about missing Fontconfig cache directory. - Do not use the OCI Docker image format yet to keep better compatibility (e.g with older docker clients).
###v23.02.1 (2023-02-04) - Updated baseimage to version 4.3.3, which brings robustness related enhancements.
###v23.01.3 (2023-01-15) - Fixed issue where the AMC script would not use the configured UMASK value.
###v23.01.2 (2023-01-10) - Fixed error that was occurring during license installation.
###v23.01.1 (2023-01-08) - Added the ability to disable the FileBot GUI. - Added the ability to disable the AMC script. - Updated MediaInfo library to version 22.12 - Versioning scheme of the Docker image changed to `YY.MM.SEQUENCE`. - Update of the baseimage to version 4.3.2 brings the following new features: - Multi-arch image support. - Support for dark mode. - Support for remote window resize. - Updated the web UI with a new, simplified and less intrusive look.
###v1.14.1 (2022-03-14) - Updated FileBot to version 4.9.6 (r9125).
###v1.14.0 (2022-02-24) - Updated FileBot to version 4.9.5 (r9112). - Fixed an issue where a folder could not be selected from the selection window. - Fixed an issue where some icons were missing from the file/folder selection window.
###v1.13.0 (2022-02-21) - Java 17 is now used to run FileBot. - Language used by AMC to rename files can now be set via the `AMC_LANG` environment variable. - Allow using a beta version of FieBot by using the `USE_FILE_BETA` environment variable. - Updated MediaInfo library to version 21.09. - Updated Chromaprint to version 1.5.1. - Allow replacing a license without having to remove the old one - Now using baseimage version 3.5.8, based on Alpine 3.15, which brings the following change: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.
###v1.12.0 (2021-10-15) - Updated FileBot to version 4.9.4 (r8735). - Adjusted the way the output folder is tested for write permission to support mapping to a NFSv4 share.
###v1.11.1 (2021-04-01) - Updated MediaInfo library to version 21.03.
###v1.11.0 (2021-03-31) - Updated FileBot to version 4.9.3 (r8340).
###v1.10.2 (2020-10-02) - Fixed issue where selecting a file/folder would show an error message.
###v1.10.1 (2020-10-02) - Fixed issue where FileBot and AMC would crash/hang.
###v1.10.0 (2020-10-01) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.9.2. - Updated baseimage to version 3.5.6, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded glibc to version 2.31 on Alpine Linux images with glibc integrated. - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Adjusted the log monitor target for recent versions of YAD.
###v1.9.2 (2020-06-24) - Improved handling of options contained in `AMC_CUSTOM_OPTIONS`.
###v1.9.1 (2020-04-25) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.9.1. - Fixed issue that would prevent renaming files.
###v1.9.0 (2020-03-18) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.9.0. - Switched to baseimage based on Alpine 11.
###v1.8.0 (2019-12-30) - Custom arguments can now be passed to FileBot UI via the `FILEBOT_CUSTOM_OPTIONS` environment variable. - Now using baseimage v3.5.3, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Make sure the tzdata is installed.
###v1.7.0 (2019-12-08) - Added the ability to install custom Alpine Linux packages. This allows user-defined scripts invoked by the AMC script to use tools that are normally not part of the container image.
###v1.6.0 (2019-11-19) - Added the ability to configure the input and output folders used by the AMC script.
###v1.5.3 (2019-11-05) - Fixed issue where the configured umask was not used by the AMC script.
###v1.5.2 (2019-11-05) - Fixed issue where the AMC script would not run under the proper user.
###v1.5.1 (2019-11-04) - Implemented workaround for the AMC script's artwork and nfo fetching not working without xattr support.
###v1.5.0 (2019-10-29) - The ability to fetch artwork and generate NFO file using the AMC script is now configurable.
###v1.4.0 (2019-10-28) - The match mode used by the AMC script is now configurable.
###v1.3.1 (2019-10-24) - The AMC script is now invoked with the `-non-strict` option.
###v1.3.0 (2019-10-13) - Added support for the FileBot's Automated Media Center (AMC) script.
###v1.2.4 (2019-04-26) - Now using baseimage v3.5.2, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes. - Fixed issue where the container could have a zombie process. - Fixed issue where the password would not be submitted when pressing the enter key in the password modal. - Use relative path for favicon ressources to be more friendly with reverse proxy senarios.
###v1.2.3 (2019-04-03) - Upgraded FileBot to final version 4.8.5 (r6224).
###v1.2.2 (2019-03-26) - Adjusted archive extraction to work with the latest FileBot build.
###v1.2.1 (2019-03-25) - Use 7zip for archive extraction.
###v1.2.0 (2019-02-24) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.8.5. - Use baseimage based on Alpine Linux 3.9.
###v1.1.5 (2019-01-07) - The default folder when loading files is now `/storage`.
###v1.1.4 (2018-09-18) - Now using baseimage v3.5.1, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.
###v1.1.3 (2018-08-29) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.8.4 (r5846).
###v1.1.2 (2018-08-27) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.8.2 (r5789).
###v1.1.1 (2018-07-30) - Fixed issue where the pop-up window about FileBot requiring a license would be shown more than once.
###v1.1.0 (2018-07-30) - Upgraded FileBot to version 4.8.2. - Now using baseimage v3.4.0, which is based on Alpine Linux 3.8.
###v1.0.2 (2018-03-02) - Now using baseimage v3.3.4, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - Make sure the log monitor is started after the X server. - Fixed an issue where the log monitor `yad` target would use XDG folders of the application. - Fixed issue where log monitor states were not cleared during container startup.
###v1.0.1 (2018-02-03) - Now using baseimage v3.3.2, which brings the following changes: - Restored timezone support in Alpine Linux images with glibc. - Fixed issue in `add-pkg` helper where a package could be incorrectly detected as installed.
###v1.0.0 (2018-01-31) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, states, log and any files needing persistency.

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible to the application.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Watch Directory
Config.Description: This is the input folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Any media copied to this folder will be processed by the script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Output Directory
Config.Description: This is the output folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. This is where medias are located once they are renamed and organized.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority. NOTE: Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, "--cap-add=SYS_NICE" must be added to Extra Parameters (shown when Advanced View is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Dark Mode
Config.Description: When set to "1", dark mode is enabled for the application.

Config.Name: Web Audio
Config.Description: When set to "1", audio support is enabled, meaning that any audio produced by the application is played through the browser. Note that audio is not supported for VNC clients.

Config.Name: Web Authentication
Config.Description: When set to "1", the application' GUI is protected via a login page when accessed via a web browser.

Config.Name: Web Authentication Username
Config.Description: Optional username to configure for the web authentication. This is a quick and easy way to configure credentials for a single user. To configure credentials in a more secure way, or to add more users, see the documentation.

Config.Name: Web Authentication Password
Config.Description: Optional password to configure for the web authentication. This is a quick and easy way to configure credentials for a single user. To configure credentials in a more secure way, or to add more users, see the documentation.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to "1" to encrypt the connection. NOTE: When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated. This one-time operation is done during container startup. Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes. GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

Config.Name: Secure Connection VNC Method
Config.Description: Method used to perform the secure VNC connection. Possible values are "SSL" or "TLS".

Config.Name: Secure Connection Certificate Check Interval
Config.Description: Interval, in seconds, at which the system verifies if web or VNC certificates have changed. When a change is detected, the affected services are automatically restarted. A value of "0" disables the check.

Config.Name: Web Listening Port (Non-Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port used by the web server to serve the UI of the application. This port is used internally by the container and it is usually not required to be changed. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to something else than Bridge.

Config.Name: VNC Listening Port (Non-Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port used by the VNC server to serve the UI of the application. This port is used internally by the container and it is usually not required to be changed. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to something else than Bridge.

Config.Name: FileBot GUI State
Config.Description: Setting this to 1 enables the FileBot GUI, 0 disables it.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: State
Config.Description: Setting this to 1 enables the Automated Media Center (AMC) scrip, 0 disables it.

Config.Name: OpenSubtitles Username
Config.Description: Username of your OpenSubtitles (https://www.opensubtitles.org) account. Required to download subtitles.

Config.Name: OpenSubtitles Password
Config.Description: Password of your OpenSubtitles (https://www.opensubtitles.org) account. Required to download subtitles.

Config.Name: Custom Options
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to FileBot. This applies to the UI only.

Config.Name: Use FileBot Beta Version
Config.Description: When set to 1, FileBot installed under /config/beta (container path) is used. If no FileBot installation is found under this folder, the latest beta version is automatically downloaded during container startup. **NOTE**: Use at your own risk. Beta version may have bugs and stability issues.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Interval
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) between each invocation of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Input Stable Time
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of files in the watch folder need to remain the same before invoking the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. This is to avoid processing the watch folder while files are being copied.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Action
Config.Description: Action performed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script on files. Valid values are "test", "copy", "move", "symlink", "hardlink", "keeplink", "duplicate" or "clone". Use the "test" operation to perform a dry-run and verify that everything gets matched up correctly.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Conflict Resolution
Config.Description: Conflict resolution strategy used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. When set to "skip", existing files are never overriden, while "auto" overrides existing file only if new media is better.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Match Mode
Config.Description: Match mode used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. The "opportunistic" mode works for all files regardless how badly they are named, while "strict" mode works for reasonably well-named files and ignore files that cannot be matched accurately. See https://www.filebot.net/forums/viewtopic.php?t=4695 for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Artwork
Config.Description: When set to "y", artwork is fetched and NFO file is generated by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Language
Config.Description: Language used by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script to rename files. Two-characters language code or value like English, French, German, Chinese, etc can be used.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Music Format
Config.Description: Define how music files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See https://www.filebot.net/naming.html for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Movie Format
Config.Description: Define how movie files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See https://www.filebot.net/naming.html for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: TV Series Format
Config.Description: Define how TV series files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See https://www.filebot.net/naming.html for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Anime Format
Config.Description: Define how anime files are renamed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. Filebot supports a very powerful naming scheme. See https://www.filebot.net/naming.html for complete documentation.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Process Music
Config.Description: When set to "y", music files are processed by the Automated Media Center (AMC) script. A value of "n" does not process them.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Subtitle Languages
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of subtitle languages to download. Example: "en,de,fr".

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Custom Options
Config.Description: Custom arguments to pass to the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Input Directory
Config.Description: Directory inside the container used as the input folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: Automated Media Center: Output Directory
Config.Description: Directory inside the container used as the output folder of the Automated Media Center (AMC) script.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI (Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port to access the application's GUI via the web interface. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to "Bridge".

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI (Bridge Network Type)
Config.Description: Port to access the application's GUI via VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to "Bridge".
